document.masterDocTitle: A new species of the genus Zercon (Acari, Zerconidae) from Turkey

mods:titleInfo.mods:title: A new species of the genus Zercon (Acari, Zerconidae) from Turkey

subSubSection.paragraph:
Material Examined. Holotype : Ψ, Turkey , 42 km north of Bolu settlement, National Park of Yedi Göller, 800–900 m a.s.l.,
15 May 2001
. Sample of litter and soil in a coniferous forest (mostly
Pinus
sp.). Paratypes : 3 Ψ, 4 ɗ, 3 deutonymphs, one protonymph, same data as holotype . Type material is deposited in the Department of Zoology of Pamukkale University, Denizli, Turkey .

Dorsal idiosoma (
Figs. 1
A, B). Length of idiosoma in holotype 460 µm, width 330 µm. Measurement of three paratypes , length 456 ( 438–475 ) µm, width 328 ( 315–343 ) µm. Ornamentation of the dorsal shields is shown in
Figure 1
A. Dorsal pits are distinct, well-sclerotized, uniform in size, with short axes parallel to the body axis.

Setae . Podonotal seta j 1 feathered; r 3 –r 6 finely barbed; remaining setae of the podonotum short and smooth. Opisthonotal setae J 1 –J 3 , Z 1 , Z 2 , and S 1 short and smooth; J 4 –J 6 long and barbed, with hyaline tips. Seta J 3 does not reach insertion of seta J 4 . Length of J 4 approximately twice as long as the distance J 4 –J 5 . Seta J 5 reaches beyond posterior margin of opisthonotum. The insertions of setae J 6 –J 6 157 µm apart. Bases of setae J 6 and Z 5 very close together. Setae Z 3 and Z 4 similar to seta J 5 ; Z 2 short, only about one-third as long as the distance Z 2 –Z 3 . Seta Z 3 reaches the insertion of seta Z 4 ; Z 4 projects beyond posterior margin of opisthonotum. Seta Z 5 finely barbed; S 2 –S 4 long and barbed with hyaline tips. Seta S 2 reaches margin of opisthonotum. Seta S 3 projects half of its length beyond margin of opisthonotum. Setae R 1 –R 4 finely barbed; remaining setae of row R short and smooth. Length of opisthonotal setae and distances between setae within longitudinal rows are as in
Table 1
.

caption.paragraph:
TABLE 1. Lengths of opisthonotal setae and longitudinal distances between them in
Zercon kezbaniremae
(adult female)

subSubSection.paragraph:
J
6 - 81
( 80–83 ) Pores (
Fig. 1
A). Pore Po 1 located above the insertion of seta Z 1 . Pore Po 2 lies on the line connecting setae Z 2 –S 2 . Pore Po 3 lies on the line connecting setae Z 4 –J 3 , closer to Z 4 . Pore Po 4 lies on the line connecting setae S 4 –Z 5 , closer to S 4 .

caption.paragraph:
FIGURE 1.
Zercon kezbaniremae
sp.nov. Female: A. Dorsal idiosoma, B. Ventral idiosoma. Male: C. Dorsal idiosoma, D. Ventral idiosoma. Deutonymph: E. Dorsal idiosoma. Protonymph: F. Dorsal idiosoma.

subSubSection.paragraph:
Ven t er (
Fig. 1
B). Chaetotaxy and shape of the peritrematal shield are typical for the genus. Adgenital shields present, with four pores. Anterior magrin of the ventri-anal shield with four setae.

Male (
Figs. 1
C, D). Idiosoma mean length 357 ( 343–370 ) µm, mean width 232 ( 230–235 ) µm. Setae, pores, and sculpturing pattern on the podonotum and opisthonotum as in female. Distance between setae J 6 –J 6 128 ( 125–130 ) µm. Length of opisthonotal setae and distances between setae within longitudinal rows are as in Table 2 .

TABLE 2 .
Lengths of opisthonotal setae and longitudinal distances between them in
Zercon kezbaniremae
(adult male) S 1 - 20 Z 1 - 12 ( 10–13 ) J 1 - 14 ( 13–15 ) 38 ( 35–40 ) 37 ( 35–38 ) 38 ( 35–40 )

Deutonymph (
Fig. 1
E). Length of idiosoma in three paratypes 372 ( 363–380 ) µm, width 240 ( 230–250 ) µm. Podonotal setae j 1 pilose; r 3 , r 5 and r 6 finely barbed; remainder smooth. Opisthonotal setae J 1 –J 5 , Z 1 and Z 2 short and smooth; J 6 , Z 3 , Z 4 , S 1 –S 4 long, terminally broadened with hyaline tips. The insertions of setae J 6 – J 6 115 µm apart. Seta Z 3 reaches to insertion of seta Z 4 ; Z 4 projects beyond posterior margin of opisthonotum. Seta Z 5 finely barbed. Seta S 1 reaches margin of opisthonotum. Seta S 2 projects half of its length beyond margin of opisthonotum. Pore Po 3 lies on the line connecting setae Z 4 –J 2 , closer to Z 4 . Setae R 1 and R 2 finely barbed; remaining setae of row R short and smooth. Length of opisthonotal setae and distances between setae within longitudinal rows are as in
Table 3
.

caption.paragraph:
TABLE 3. Lengths of opisthonotal setae and longitudinal distances between them in
Zercon kezbaniremae
(deutonymph)

subSubSection.paragraph:
Protonymph (
Fig. 1
F): Length of idiosoma 283 µm, width 158 µm. Podonotal setae j 1 and r 3 finely barbed; remainder smooth. Opisthonotal setae J 1 –J 5 , Z 1 and Z 2 short and smooth; J 6 , Z 3 , Z 4 , S 1 –S 4 long, terminally broadened with hyaline tips. The insertions of setae J 6 –J 6 115 µm apart. Length of opisthonotal setae and distances between setae within longitudinal rows are as in
Table 4
.

caption.paragraph:
TABLE 4. Lengths of opisthonotal setae and longitudinal distances between them in
Zercon kezbaniremae
(protonymph)

subSubSection.paragraph:
J 6 - 70 Remarks.
Zercon kezbaniremae
sp. nov.
is closely related to
Z . bajcalensis
Błaszak, 1979
and
Z . serenus
Halašková, 1969
. They may be distinguished according to the features given in
Table 5
.
Etymology. I dedicate the new species to my daughter, Kezban İrem Urhan (five years old).
